main event: Multiple sightings of unidentified spherical objects with unusual behavior over Great Falls, Montana in 1957.
interesting points: One sighting described a round bright white light, similar in size to the North Star, spinning at high speed and then disappearing into the clouds.
Another sighting reported two silver spherical objects, about 3 feet in diameter, flying at an estimated altitude of 10,000 feet with no visible means of propulsion.
The sightings were referred to the 2nd AF Operations at Offutt AFB for further analysis, indicating the seriousness with which these events were treated.
The names of the observers were Mr. & Mrs. Plant, indicating multiple credible witnesses.
The UFO report did not include any photographs, and one of the sightings was attributed to probably being caused by a balloon based on the description and manner of disappearance.
